question: India is set to join hands with which country to conduct Marine spatial planning in Lakshadweep and Puducherry?
explanation:
As per the recent announcement of the Ministry of Earth Sciences, India and Norway will coordinate in the area of marine spatial planning for the next five years.
The countries have identified Lakshadweep and Puducherry as pilot sites for the project. This is a part of the Indo-Norway Integrated Ocean Initiative under the MoU signed between the two countries in 2019.
